text: <@U03FJQPSC0Y> I am one of those people. Despite actually being able to write JS and some dubious React, I trust that my engineers are much better at writing the JS. I just need to easily visualise my :sparkles: vision :sparkles: for them. Also, the more we develop extensions, the more requests we get from outside of the admin competency. Being able to quickly sketch it out in a UI/UX tool would make this process smoother and allow us to align quicker. Happy to jump on a call if needed.
Thanks for bringing this use case to our attention! We’ll investigate into this more.

Hi all, I’m having issues creating associations between objects using a serverless function. It works when developing locally, however when I push the project changes to the portal I get this error:
```"Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'basicApi')"```
This happens when I attempt to associate objects together using the NodeJS client like so:
```await HubSpotClient.crm.associations.v4.basicApi.create(
        'quotes',
        quoteResponse.id,
        'deals',
        dealId,
        [
            {
                "associationCategory": "HubSpot_DEFINED",
                "associationTypeId": 64
            }
        ]
    )   ```
My original approach was to include the association in the record creation, which again works in local dev. However the record is created and the association is ignored when I send the request once the project is uploaded.

Anybody have any ideas?
do you have `@HubSpot/api-client` in package.json in `app.functions` ?
Bumping this up in case anyone missed it!
It was there but at version 7.0.1, a newer version works. Thanks!
